reviews.text: A lot of bad reviews about this hotel and I really cant see why.. The staff couldn't do enough and were extremely friendly, we travelled with our 6 month year old baby and they were brilliant with him. Hotel rooms are larger than expected and cleaned daily. There wasn't a problem with the sunbeds and location is perfect for a nice stroll into town / beach. Far enough out of Las Americas but near enough to Playa La Vistas (best place to be in the area). Only problem with the hotel is that the long trouser rule in the restaurants for dinner is not advertised and I only had one pair (very annoying, but understandable) and the fresh water pool at that time of year was too cold (but allowed me to "man up" and do 30 lengths a day in an empty pool). Brilliant Holiday..
reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel

reviews.text: PS I must also recommend the two market days in Los Christianos and Costa Adeje, loads of bargains to be had
reviews.title: Don't book Loro Park through the Rep

reviews.text: Booked the Marylanza Hotel with Thomson and travelled with husband and child. When we arrived at the hotel we were upgraded from full board to all inclusive which was good. Our room looked over the golf course which was lovely and despite the terrace being in the shade it kept the room cool as the air conditioning unit did not work properly. We did report this on our first morning but nothing was done about it. After attending the welcome meeting with Thomson we decided to book Loro Park and were assured by the Thomson Rep that the coach would take 1 hour and 15 minutes. The trip was expensive and cost £118 despite our child being free but as we had been told the coach would travel directly to the park unlike some of the cheaper trips, we decided to book. On the day of the trip we were told to be outside the hotel at 8.30am as the coach was due at 8.45am. The coach eventually turned up at 9.15am. Despite being told by the rep that the journey would take 1 hour and 15 minutes we were still picking up other people at 10.30am from hotels miles away from the resort. We eventually reached Loro Park at 11.40am and managed to get into the park after being deserted by the coach guide at 12 noon. This was despite being promised by the rep that we would fast track any queues as we had paid upfront at the hotel. We missed the first dolphin show at 11am and had to rush through 3 shows before 3pm. We took the decision to miss the Loro Park parrot show as there was not time and our child needed feeding, even this was a disaster as we had to queue for 45 minutes and pay 19.50 euros for 3 cold burgers and cold chips as there was not time for a sit down meal. The coach set off back to the hotel at 4.30pm and we arrived back at 6.45p,m. In total we had spent more time sat on a coach than we did in the park. Thi trip was not even half a day as the park did not close until 7pm. On our return we confronted the rep with many other guests and she promised to look into what had gone wrong and let us know by the following Friday. This did not happen and after contacting the 24/7 help line we were informed that the Rep was busy at the airport and they had not managed to find anything out. We were then advised to email Thomson on our return but were informed by automated service that this could take upto 28 days for a reply. We have travelled with Thomson before but have noticed a marked difference in quality of service since they joined with First Choice. On previous occasions the reps have gone out of their way to provide an excellent standard of customer service but we felt on this occasion the rep's attitude was to avoid the situation and do nothing. We were told that this had been a one off occurence but I have my doubts. The coach to take us back to the airport was also 30 minutes late , and was so full that I was unable to get 2 seats together and had to sit with my child on my lap for the entire journey, without a seat belt this was totally unnecessary and had happened because the rep had allowed other travellers travelling to other UK airports to travel on the coach after we had been told by another rep that we had to wait for the appropriate coach. This broke many health and safety laws and the rep even had the cheek to remind everyone that it was compulsory to wear seat belts on the coach if they were provided despite overbooking the seats. They also could not be bothered to apologise for being 30 minutes late which sums up the overall service. These experiences spolit what would have been a good holiday. One tip to pass on to other travellers would be that the safe in the room works off your key card so do not pay out any money, just follow the instructions on the front of the safe and you will save at least 20 euros.
reviews.title: Not what we expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 10 days just before Easter. Booked with Thompson so unsuprisingly got a room facing the road which was a little disappointing. Plenty of room space but litte sound proofing so woken up most mornings about 7am by cleaning staff. Had to be on a sunbed by 7:30am or else all taken - sun didnt reach the pool area to about 9:30am so spent a few mornings shivering on rickerty loungers in semi darkness, too scared to move in case the eagle eyed pool guard removed my towels. Food Ok but gentlemen have to wear long trousers for the evening meal whilst women can wear just about anything and did. After paying for one round of drinks decided to upgrade to all inclusive at 15 Euros per person per day which I considerd to be good value. Entertainment was the usual snake show including other exotic but uninteresting animals eg a dwarf pig!, Elvis impersonator, and tribute acts but alas no Michael Jackson this year but Bingo was played on a regular basis.
reviews.title: Last minute holiday !

reviews.text: I think Thomspons have been economical with the truth in describing this hotel as Premium. In my opinion its more akin to a Spanish travel lodge with pools and deserves no more than 3 stars. I cant say we had a bad holiday but I never found myself able to relax as I have been able to do on similar budget holidays. In short I cannot recommend this hotel as there looked to be better hotels, with a more convenient location, in this resort.
reviews.title: relaxing holiday would recommend

reviews.text: This Hotel is never a 5* I cant even think where to begin. staff are miserable & so unhelpful if you go with kids like I did they will be bored senseless kids club what kids club? kids pool was filthy sun loungers are broken parasols are broken dont go & put your towels down to get some loungers because the staff come round & take the towels away I could write a lot more but i was disgusted by this hotel ... ive wrote to thomson about my rescent stay here i would LOVE to know what was premium/platinum about this place as it lets the thomson group down badly........ ALL IN ALL DO NOT GO HERE
reviews.title: DO NOT GO TO THIS HOTEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from Marylanza after 14 night stay. We experienced a huge comfortable suite with a double sun filled balcony overlooking gardens with superb blooms. The service from staff throughout the hotel was exceptional and during the 2 week period we were there, 20th March to 3rd April, we were amazed at the variety of food availabe at all meals. Within the 2 weeks we had BBQs, International Nights, Italian Nights, Oriental Nights and a Canarian Night. The quality of food and cleanliness was top notch and we sampled everything from Sirloin Steaks, Carvery Lamb, Beef and Pork, Veal dishes to die for, Pasta, Pizza and Fish dishes including Hake, Sole, Calamari etc. We were AI and there was a good range of local wine, beer and sprits available without having to queue endlessly. We travelled with Thompson and had a fantastic fortnight with glorious sunshine every day. Yes it is a fair walk to the Playa del Vistas beach but with the amount of food on offer the excercise was welcome!
reviews.title: Marvellous, Magnificant Marylanza.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed a week at Marylanza AI with my husband for a relaxing week away,unfortunately,that's not what we got.When we arrived we had made it just in time for dinner which was bbq night,it was very nice.Had a few drinks at bar then off to our room.Rooms are nice and spacious but when we went to bed there was a loud blowing sound.After a short time we discovered it was coming from our bathroom,which had a large vent on ceiling,so in the morning complained to rep,nothing was done.That night the room was freezing,i had to go to bed with socks on!!Complained to rep again,was told all rooms the same so why bother moving.I asked to be moved to another hotel of the same standard but got nowhere,they then sent a tech to our room who did'nt speak a word of english,he was supposed to take temp of room but only showed us how to switch air-con on and off,showed him bathroom problem,he shrugged his shoulders and just said reception.So none of our problems solved.Out of the seven nights i think we only got about two nights half decent sleep.On a plus side the staff are great and the food good but can get a bit repetitive as it was international night nearly every night,but only one night we could'nt eat anything they put on.There is nothing round about the hotel,but a 15 minute walk either way takes you to las americas or los cristianos.
reviews.title: Nice hotel,friendly staff but noisy room.

reviews.text: It is a family hotel so lots of kids,but that wasn'nt really a problem as they do lots with them.
reviews.title: Nice four star hotel, spacious rooms, nice staff. Great location if you do not mind a short walk to bars or beach

reviews.text: The pool area was nice with three pools,the beds have seen better days and was'nt to difficult getting one apart from maybe one day.
reviews.title: Excellent Family hotel

reviews.text: Just back from the Marylanza and have to say that I agree with some of the negative reviews. Don't want to be too wordy so in brief;
reviews.title: Mixed - not as great as we expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positives
reviews.title: Ignore The Fussy Reviews, This Place Is GRRRREAT!

reviews.text: - nice spacious accommodation, clean and well presented (agree with previous review that the pillows are really uncomfortable)
reviews.title: Brill hotel excellent first choice staff!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - restaurant staff and the maids were very friendly and attentive
reviews.title: no way is this premier standard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - pools lovely
reviews.title: Shame holiday - about the sunbed hogging

reviews.text: We have just returned from a weeks stay at the Marylanza. I do not agree the staff are rude and unhelpful, we found them to be quite the opposite.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, but some faults

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most of the apartments face the roadside, this is a positive rather than a negative. I asked for a pool view but was so glad we didnt get it. The rooms are lovely and spotlessly clean. They are cleaned everyday with daily towel changes and weekly sheet change. The food in the restaurant is lovely with plenty of choice, no complaints with that at all.
reviews.title: heartbreaking

reviews.text: The hotel is about 10 minute walk to Los Christianos and Playa Americas, and about a 15 minute walk to the beach. I find it strange that a previous visitor spent so much on taxi's. Im sure it wasnt necessary, maybe they did not know the short cuts down to the town and beach. We found the walk relaxing and welcoming on a sunny morning, and especially welcoming on a evening after eating lots in the restaurant !
reviews.title: not what i expected.Trip Advisor summed it all up

reviews.text: My complaint about this hotel is the pool area. Selfish people putting their towels out on sunbeds at ridiculous o'clock in the morning. It doesnt give anyone else a chance to sit there and as a result we spent everyday at the beach. This is ok but children do enjoy the pool and mine did not go in the pool once during our stay. It literally is a case of some families taking over, which is so unfair. I refused to get into the trap of putting towels out, I wont participate in it. The hotel seriously needs to do something about it. The sunbeds (what I saw of them) are ready for the rubbish heap and need replacing. The hotel is really nice and clean. The entertainment is good, but this pool business is letting it down seriously.
reviews.title: Hotel didn't meet my expectations!!

reviews.text: i booked this holiday as a treat for my husband who was 40 while away but wasnt a treat at all...we arrived on the fri looked ok but then we soon found out...it was mainly germans staying there with children who thought it ok to allow their children to run riot at all times...very noisy hotel...we stayed for a week spent a fortune on taxis to take us 2 the beach as sunbeds were taking by 7am every day...poor entertainment what of it...staff rude and not interested...husband was told off by restaurant manager for wearing 3/4 trousers in front of everyone and was grabbed by the arm complained to reception told us to tell our rep but she was too busy booking her trips and stealing the all inclusive customers cakes from bar top...room wasnt the best one like we were suppose to have as shown...no holiday atmosphere just one big con lets go to watchdog!!!!!
reviews.title: New Sun Loungers please!
